item.title: Doug add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description:
"And on the subject of burning books: I want to congratulate librarians, not famous for their physical strength or their powerful political connections or their great wealth, who, all over this country, have staunchly resisted anti-democratic bullies who have tried to remove certain books from their shelves, and have refused to reveal to thought police the names of persons who have checked out those titles.
So the America I loved still exists, if not in the White House or the Supreme Court or the Senate or the House of Representatives or the media. The America I love still exists at the front desks of our public libraries." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Doug add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I love deadlines. I love the whooshing noise they make as they go by." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Doug add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "There is a theory which states that if ever anyone discovers exactly what the Universe is for and why it is here, it will instantly disappear and be replaced by something even more bizarre and inexplicable. There is another theory which states that this has already happened." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Doug add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "To lose one parent may be regarded as a misfortune; to lose both looks like carelessness." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Doug add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description:
"Never put off till tomorrow what may be done day after tomorrow just as well".
From: "More Maxims of Mark" -- Mark Twain

item.title: Doug add a quote by John Lennon
item.description: "If everyone demanded peace instead of another television set, then there'd be peace." -- John Lennon

item.title: Doug add a quote by George McGovern
item.description: "I'm fed up to the ears with old men dreaming up wars for young men to die in." -- George McGovern

item.title: Doug add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "A lie can travel half way around the world while the truth is putting on its shoes." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Doug add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "Love never dies a natural death. It dies because we don't know how to replenish its source. It dies of blindness and errors and betrayals. It dies of illness and wounds; it dies of weariness, of witherings, of tarnishings." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Doug add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Doug add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Doug add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Doug add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Doug add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Don't walk behind me; I may not lead. Don't walk in front of me; I may not follow. Just walk beside me and be my friend." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Doug add a quote by Plato
item.description: "The price good men pay for indifference to public affairs is to be ruled by evil men." -- Plato

item.title: Doug add a quote by Adlai Stevenson
item.description: "A hungry man is not a free man." -- Adlai Stevenson

item.title: Doug add a quote by Adlai E. Stevenson
item.description: "A hypocrite is the kind of politician who would cut down a redwood tree, then mount the stump and make a speech for conservation." -- Adlai E. Stevenson

item.title: Doug add a quote by Adlai E. Stevenson II
item.description: "All progress has resulted from people who took unpopular positions." -- Adlai E. Stevenson II

item.title: Doug add a quote by Gore Vidal
item.description: "Half of the American people have never read a newspaper. Half never voted for President. One hopes it is the same half." -- Gore Vidal

item.title: Doug add a quote by Nicolas Chamfort
item.description: "A day without laughter is a day wasted." -- Nicolas Chamfort

item.title: Doug add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "Did you ever stop to think, and forget to start again?" -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Doug add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "I don't want to achieve immortality through my work; I want to achieve immortality through not dying. I don't want to live on in the hearts of my countrymen; I want to live on in my apartment." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Doug add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Doug add a quote by Jean-Paul Sartre
item.description: "When the rich wage war it's the poor who die." -- Jean-Paul Sartre

item.title: Doug add a quote by Bessie Anderson Stanley
Doug add a quote by Anne Frank
item.description: "It's really a wonder that I haven't dropped all my ideals, because they seem so absurd and impossible to carry out. Yet I keep them, because in spite of everything, I still believe that people are really good at heart." -- Anne Frank

item.title: Doug add a quote by Socrates
item.description: "The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing." -- Socrates

item.title: Doug add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "She generally gave herself very good advice, (though she very seldom followed it)." -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Doug add a quote by Emmanuel Kant
item.description: "He who is cruel to animals becomes hard also in his dealings with men. We can judge the heart of a man by his treatment of animals." -- Emmanuel Kant

item.title: Doug add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "You see things; you say, 'Why?' But I dream things that never were; and I say 'Why not?" -- George Bernard Shaw
